label: 新嘗祭
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: (alt., Shinjōsai) an annual royal rite wherein first fruits were offered to the deities by the Great King and later by the tennō in thanksgiving for an abundant harvest. It appears in Yamato court records for the late seventh century, and later annual performance was mandated by the ritsuryō Law on Deities of Heaven and Earth.　[天皇、律令] ↓[HW:  also read にいあえのまつり]
